title.narrative: SUPPORT FOR NEW AND EXPANDED POLICIES

description.narrative: Strengthened national government capacity to plan and budget for new and expanded policies for children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Evaluation And Research, Maternal And Newborn Health, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, girls and boys, particularly the most disadvantaged and excluded, have increased access and utilization of effective, efficient and equitable essential social services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national government capacity to plan and budget for new and expanded policies for children.

description.narrative: The knowledge and capacity for the design and implementation of new policies for children among partners from NDRC, MOF and academia have been improved in 2020. UNICEF-supported evidence informed national partners’ decisions on key priorities for children during the 14th FYP development, prioritizing child wellbeing in policy development and resource allocation at the macro level and in specific service areas, including ECC for children aged 0-3 and protection services for rural children left-behind.; ; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2021

title.narrative: Substantive policy analysis undertaken and knowledge products disseminated to support planning and budgeting in (a) child protection, (b) early childhood development and (c) health(45269)

target.value: 2020:3 initiatives in CP 3 initiatives in ECD 3 initiatives in health
